newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Software Artistry to raise Asian profile.
newsitem.headline: Software Artistry to raise Asian profile.

text.p: U.S.-based Software Artistry plans to increase its presence in Asia through dealerships and joint ventures, said a senior company official on Thursday.
The company provides support services for computer networks of large corporations where people can call into a helpdesk for assistance.

Presently, Software Artistry has a regional office in Singapore and has appointed dealers in Singapore and Hong Kong. It is in the process of appointing dealers in Indonesia and Malaysia in the near future, said Bob Davies, the company's Asia Pacific vice president.
After that, the company would target Thailand, India and the Philippines. It is eyeing a joint venture in Japan to set up similar services, he said.
"We hope to see a 20 percent contribution from Asia-Pacific to the group's total revenue by 1998," said Davies.
He said the Asia-Pacific region was expected to make a modest 3.0 to 5.0 percent contribution to group revenue this year.
In the fiscal year ended Decemebr 1995, Software Artistry recorded net profit of US$3.7 million on a turnover of US$25.6 million.
